title: Three anti-social skills to improve your writing - Nadia Kalman
description:
TED-Ed
14.7M subscribers
SUBSCRIBE
View full lesson: http://ed.ted.com/lessons/three-anti-...

You need social skills to have a conversation in real life -- but they're quite different from the skills you need to write good dialogue. Educator Nadia Kalman suggests a few "anti-social skills," like eavesdropping and muttering to yourself, that can help you write an effective dialogue for your next story.

Lesson by Nadia Kalman, animation by Enjoyanimation.
SHOW LESS

title: How to write descriptively - Nalo Hopkinson
description:
TED-Ed
14.7M subscribers
SUBSCRIBE
View full lesson: http://ed.ted.com/lessons/how-to-writ...

The point of fiction is to cast a spell, a momentary illusion that you are living in the world of the story. But as a writer, how do you suck your readers into your stories in this way? Nalo Hopkinson shares some tips for how to use language to make your fiction really come alive. 

Lesson by Nalo Hopkinson, animation by Enjoyanimation.
SHOW LESS

title: Writing - Transitions - in addition, moreover, furthermore, another
description:
English Lessons with Adam - Learn English [engVid]
2.66M subscribers
SUBSCRIBE
http://www.engvid.com One of the most important tools for creating good flow in writing is the transition. Transitions are the bridges that allow a reader to move from one idea to the next without getting lost in the language. In this writing lesson, we'll look specifically at transitions to join similar, supporting ideas. I'll teach you how to use 'in addition', 'furthermore', 'moreover', 'another', and more. Take a quiz on this lesson here: http://www.engvid.com/writing-transit...

title: How To Write Professional Business Emails | Chris Guerriero
description:
Chris Guerriero
15.8K subscribers
SUBSCRIBE
Looking for an edge to grow your business? Check out my free tools at https://www.chrisguerriero.com 

I’ve made a lot of money from sending business emails. In fact, the format that I’ll be sharing with you in this video recently brought in $100,000 for my business. 

But I’ve also seen business owners lose money and damage their brand by sending poorly worded or badly timed emails.

In this video I’ll be sharing my best email tips and strategies for how to write and send emails that foster and build relationships rather than risk ruining them.

These rules apply for all business emails you might send, whether it’s a summary of a conversation you just had, a follow up email, trying to close a deal and anything else you can think of.

My rules:

1:26 – What’s the correct email length?
2:23 – How many topics should you cover? 
2:49 – How fast should you respond to an email?
3:27 - Considering email tone & emotional states 
4:23 - Don’t go back and forth!
4:48 - How to deliver bad news 
5:46 – Keep the end in mind

Always remember that communicating via email is not something to be rushed. If you want a profitable outcome, take your time, double check you’ve followed these rules, and soon enough they’ll become second nature.

#businessemail #businessemailtips #businesscommunication 

===

SUBSCRIBE TO THE CHANNEL: https://ChrisGuerriero.com/yt

Schedule: New episodes at least 3x every week on a broad array of entrepreneurial topics.

Chris is an entrepreneur, investor, bestselling author, and business adviser to a handful of high growth companies. He has built four 8-figure companies, developed winning leadership teams across multiple industries, and designed business systems that predictably grow multi-million-dollar brands. He’s been featured in financial periodicals such as Success, Inc, Bloomberg, and in Entrepreneur as a top entrepreneur of the time.

CONNECT WITH CHRIS ON SOCIAL MEDIA:

Blog: https://ChrisGuerriero.com/blog
Instagram: https://ChrisGuerriero.com/IG
Podcast: https://ChrisGuerriero.com/IT
LinkedIn: https://ChrisGuerriero.com/LI

Please understand that by watching Chris Guerriero's videos or enrolling in his programs does not mean you’ll get the same, similar (or really any) results. He’s been in business for over 25 years and his results are not typical. Most people who watch his videos or enroll in his programs get the “how-to” but never take action with the information. Chris is only sharing what has worked for him and his clients. Your results are dependent on many factors including but not limited to your ability to work hard, commit yourself, and do whatever it takes to succeed. Entering any business is going to involve a level of risk as well as massive commitment and action. If you're not willing to accept that, please DO NOT WATCH CHRIS' VIDEOS OR SIGN UP FOR ONE OF HIS PROGRAMS.

title: Four Keys to Effective Business Writing
description:
GreggU
75.6K subscribers
SUBSCRIBE
The purpose of effective writing at work is always to accomplish a specific goal and to be as persuasive as possible. Effective writing on the job is carefully planned, thoroughly researched, and clearly presented. 

Knowing who makes up your audience is one of your most important responsibilities as a writer. Keep in mind that you are not writing for yourself but for a specific reader or group of readers. Expect to analyze your audience throughout the com- posing process.

The tone of your writing is especially important in occupational writing because it reflects the image you project to your readers and thus determines how they will respond to you, your work, and your company. Depending on your tone, you can appear sincere and intelligent or angry and uninformed.

title: Creating A Style Guide & Voice - Business Writing & Grammar
description:
docstocTV
48.1K subscribers
SUBSCRIBE
Click here for full course playlist:http://www.youtube.com/playlist?featu...


Good writing is one of the most neglected but critical ingredients for business success. Bad writing can compromise the effectiveness of your marketing campaigns and risk your relationship with customers, clients and employees. Great writing, however, has the power to not only make an excellent first impression, but to persuade people to listen to you. This 
course will walk you through everything you need to know in order to improve your advertisements, Facebook and twitter posts, email
newsletters, B2B communications, business proposals and much more. It will also address the most common grammatical errors that professionals make, and how to correct them.


For more information and resources, be sure to check out 
http://www.docstoc.com.

There you'll have access to an array of valuable tools to help you start and grow a business.
